resources.string: %1$s was attacked, but took no casualties
Friendly fire! One of your units was hit by a stray mortar.
Scrub is easy to move through but does not provide any cover.
Woods can help conceal enemy units and do provide some cover when defending.
Rocky terrain is tough to move into, but provides great benefits when defending against an attack.
Enemy infantry squads are not as strong as your platoons, but can easily disappear back into the terrain when you are not adjacent to them.
An enemy machine gun team that can attack two squares away and has a chance to suppress your units.
Enemy sniper teams can pin down your units from a greater distance and cause them to be suppressed easily.

A headquarters unit can remove suppression from any unit it is adjacent to at the end of the your turn. Plus, any enemy unit within two squares always remains visible. However, it doesn\'t pack much of an offensive punch.
Infantry platoons consist of several squads with mixture of semi-automatic rifles and machine guns. They can only attack adjacent enemy units.
The machine gun section provides the company with additional firepower and can attack enemy units two squares away.
Mortars provides an indirect attack capability up to five squares away. The mortar section can also conduct \"recon by fire\" attacking into terrain to identify hidden enemy units.
You did not clear this sector which will result in the failure of the battalion assault againt the enemy stronghold.
You successfully cleared this sector allowing the larger battalion attack to occur. Based on the number of turns it took and status of your company, you have earned %1$d out of 3 stars.

You have 25 turns to clear this sector, otherwise the main battalion attack is at risk of failure. Intel is estimating %1$s enemy units in this area with a potential mix of automatic weapons, machine guns and maybe snipers. Good luck!
Fire mortars into this map square?
Not in the rear with the gear
Win a game in seven or fewer turns
Win a game despite losing three units
Win a game just using infantry units (no mortars or machine guns)
Remove suppression from three units in one game with your HQ element
Kill three enemy units in one game with your mortars
Win a game in the last turn
Kill three enemy units in one game with your machine gun team
Win a game when one of your units took splash damage from your own mortar team
Win a game when all your units finish with full effectiveness
